means: 生小牛( calve的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The glacier calved a large iceberg.
sentence.Network_cn: 冰河崩解而形成一个大冰山.

sentence.Network_en: To Ellen, mares never foaled nor cows calved. In fact, hens almost didn't lay eggs.
sentence.Network_cn: 对于爱伦来说, 母马从不下驹儿,母牛从不产犊儿,当然, 母鸡也几乎是不生蛋的.

sentence.Network_en: Yea , the hind also calved in the field, and forsook it , because there was no grass.
sentence.Network_cn: 5田野的母鹿生下小鹿, 就撇弃, 因为无草.

so now you intend to resist the kingdom of the LORD through the sons of David , being a great multitude and having with you the golden calves Jeroboam made for gods for you .现在你们有意抗拒大卫子孙手下所治耶和华的国．你们的人也甚多、你们那里又有耶罗波安为你们所造当作神的金牛犊。

entry.def: When a cow calves, it gives birth to a calf.

example.ex: When his cows calve each year he keeps one or two calves for his family.
example.tran: 他的母牛每年产犊时,他都给自家留上一两头。

entry.def: Some other female animals, including elephants and whales, are said to calve when they give birth to their young.

example.ex: The whales migrate some 6,000 miles to breed and calve in the warm lagoons.
example.tran: 鲸会迁移6,000海里左右,到温暖的环礁湖生殖繁衍。

entry.def: Calves is the plural of calf.

means.word_mean: 1. (used of cattle especially domestic cattle) born

auth_sentence.content: The old sumbitch just come out one day and looked at where he'd calved out for fifty years and said, The ground's no good.
